requirement_text: Financial institutions must implement a risk management system proportional to their business model.
Institutions must comply with the Minimum Requirements for Risk Management (MaRisk).
Institutions are required to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data.
Institutions must establish effective IT governance structures.
Banks must conduct regular internal audits to monitor compliance with regulations.
Cybersecurity incidents must be reported promptly to BaFin.
Institutions must perform data protection impact assessments (DPIA) when processing personal data.
Personal data must be processed lawfully, fairly, and transparently in accordance with GDPR.
Banks must ensure secure data storage and encrypted communication channels.
Third-party service providers must be carefully selected and monitored.
Institutions must maintain comprehensive documentation of all compliance processes.
Customer due diligence (CDD) must be conducted in accordance with AML regulations.
Suspicious transactions must be reported to the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU).
Institutions must implement controls to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing.
Employees must receive regular training on compliance and data protection.
Banks must have a whistleblower system to report compliance violations anonymously.
Business continuity plans must be established and regularly tested.
Risk assessments must be updated regularly to reflect changes in the business environment.
Institutions must ensure the segregation of duties to prevent conflicts of interest.
Compliance officers must have independent access to the management board.
IT systems must be protected against unauthorized access and cyber attacks.
Banks must implement multi-factor authentication for critical systems.
Data backups must be performed regularly and stored securely.
Institutions must ensure transparency in all customer communications.
Banks must comply with the German Banking Act (Kreditwesengesetz, KWG).
Internal controls must be in place to monitor regulatory compliance.
Institutions must report regularly to BaFin on financial and operational risks.
Banks must prevent insider trading and market manipulation.
Institutions must protect sensitive information and trade secrets.
Automated decision-making processes must be transparent and explainable.
